title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES MODELS

description.narrative: By 2022, families and providers of early childhood services have comprehensive models for early childhood service provision and families have the knowledge and tools to improve culturally relevant parenting practices in priority areas., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

participating-org.narrative: FACULTAD LATINOAMERICANA DE CIENCIAS SOCIALES FLACSO
INSTITUTO IBEROAMERICANO DEL PATRIM NATURAL Y CULTURAL IPANC DE LA ORGANIZACION DEL CONVENIO ANDRES BE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, families and providers of early childhood services have comprehensive models for early childhood service provision andfamilies have the knowledge and tools to improve culturally relevant parenting practices in priority areas.

description.narrative: UNICEF CO focused on strengthening training in theKintiKu Yachaymodel developed to recover the cosmovision of the Kayambi people in family and community early childhood education. CO generated training processes and an advocacy strategy with local authorities for the reopening of the Early Childhood Development Centres in Cayambe. Adaptation of this model to the Karanki people aims to shape culturally appropriate early childhood education. CO gathered information in the municipalities of San Lorenzo and Eloy Alfaro (Esmeraldas) and Monte Sinaí (Guayas) to learn more about the needs of children aged 0–5. All these interventions have covered 27,400 children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

A culturally appropriate early childhood development strategy designed, validated and in early stages of implementation in key territories (67172)

actual.value: 2021:The ECD methodology called Kintiku Yachay, developed for the Kayambi community, has been consolidated. This methodology has been made available to the Ministry of Education and is currently being analyzed for possible implementation in other territories

title.narrative: Number of parents who count with information and tools to improve culturally appropriate parenting practices(67173)

baseline.value: There are messages, but there hasn't been a dissemination strategy or cultural adjustments.

actual.value: 2021:In 2021, in the context of the International Day of the Rights of the Child, together with the Ministry of Education and the Kayambi community, the book Sistema de Desarrollo Integral y de Crianza Sabia para la Vida Cotidiana, was launched.
